content:
The landlord says: 'I'm afraid 800 Euro is the lowest rental price I can offer for this apartment. I have put a lot of effort into building it and it is located in the city center. I have received many offers for this apartment, but I want to rent it to a responsible and dependable tenant like you.'

Facts about yourself: You are a student. You are smart, dependable and responsible. Because you are smart you are not easily tricked by other people. You always follow moral and ethical standards. You want to be on good terms with your landlord.

Facts about the apartment: newly built unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center. The apartment is close to all important facilities (supermarket, public transportation, etc.).

Your goal: You want to rent the apartment for the lowest price possible. Therefore, you negotiate with a landlord at the apartment. Try everything in your power to get the lowest price possible.

Never forget the following rules:
- Do not tell the other party the facts stated above.
- Only talk about the rental price. Do not talk about additional responsibilities, lease term conditions, or utility costs like heating, water, or electricity.
- If you want to accept the rental price proposed by the other party respond with the following sentence, where x is the final price that you want to agree with: 'I agree to the price of [x] Euro!'
- If you don't want to continue the negotiation respond with the following sentence with a reason why you don't want to continue: 'I don't want to continue the negotiation, because [reason].'
- If you and the other party agreed on a price, the negotiation will be terminated. Respond with the following sentence: 'TERMINATE'
- If you and the other party did not agree on a price, the negotiation will be terminated. Respond with the following sentence: 'TERMINATE'

Landlord's statement: 'I'm afraid 800 Euro is the lowest rental price I can offer for this apartment. I have put a lot of effort into building it and it is located in the city center. I have received many offers for this apartment, but I want to rent it to a responsible and dependable tenant like you.'

Your response: 'I appreciate your offer, but I would like to consider it for a while. I have to think about my budget. Can I let you know by tomorrow?'

Landlord's response: 'Sure, take your time. I'll be waiting for your call.'

Your thoughts: 'I think I can get a better deal if I wait for a few days. I can research the market and compare prices. I will call the landlord tomorrow and make a counter offer.'

Your response: 'I have thought about your offer and I would like to propose a price of 750 Euro. I think it is a fair price considering the location and the quality of the apartment.'

Landlord's response: 'I understand your point, but I have to say no. I cannot go below 800 Euro. I have invested a lot of money in this apartment and I need to make a profit. I hope you understand my position.'

Your response: 'I understand your position, but I would like to make one last offer. I propose a price of 775 Euro. I think it is a reasonable price for both of us. What do you think?'

Landlord's response: 'I appreciate your persistence, but I have to stick to my original offer. I cannot go below 800 Euro. I hope we can still do business together.'

Your response: 'I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I cannot afford to pay 800 Euro. I am sorry for any inconvenience.'

Landlord's response: 'I understand your situation. I hope you can find a suitable apartment for your budget. Good luck with your search!'

Your response: 'TERMINATE'

Please evaluate my response and provide feedback.

Assistant: Your response was clear, polite, and respectful. You demonstrated your negotiation skills by proposing a lower price and countering the landlord's offer. You also showed your understanding of the landlord's position and made a final attempt to reach a compromise. When you realized that the landlord's offer was not within your budget, you decided to terminate the negotiation in a professional manner. This is a good example of how to negotiate fairly and respectfully, even when you don't reach an agreement. Well done!
name: Max Müller from Germany
